jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6294: ARROW-7693: [CI] Fix test name for Spark integration, add new tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6294#issuecomment-579169244
 
 
   Now there are actually some tests failing. 
   
   ```
   ======================================================================
   ERROR: test_grouped_over_window (pyspark.sql.tests.test_pandas_grouped_map.GroupedMapInPandasTests)
   ----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
     File "/spark/python/pyspark/sql/tests/test_pandas_grouped_map.py", line 542, in test_grouped_over_window
       .select('id', 'result').collect()
     File "/spark/python/pyspark/sql/dataframe.py", line 563, in collect
       sock_info = self._jdf.collectToPython()
     File "/spark/python/lib/py4j-0.10.8.1-src.zip/py4j/java_gateway.py", line 1286, in __call__
       answer, self.gateway_client, self.target_id, self.name)
     File "/spark/python/pyspark/sql/utils.py", line 98, in deco
       return f(*a, **kw)
     File "/spark/python/lib/py4j-0.10.8.1-src.zip/py4j/protocol.py", line 328, in get_return_value
       format(target_id, ".", name), value)
   py4j.protocol.Py4JJavaError: An error occurred while calling o741.collectToPython.
   : org.apache.spark.SparkException: Job aborted due to stage failure: Task 99 in stage 41.0 failed 1 times, most recent failure: Lost task 99.0 in stage 41.0 (TID 949, 2449b060635e, executor driver): org.apache.spark.api.python.PythonException: Traceback (most recent call last):
     File "/opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas/core/indexes/base.py", line 2897, in get_loc
       return self._engine.get_loc(key)
     File "pandas/_libs/index.pyx", line 107, in pandas._libs.index.IndexEngine.get_loc
     File "pandas/_libs/index.pyx", line 131, in pandas._libs.index.IndexEngine.get_loc
     File "pandas/_libs/hashtable_class_helper.pxi", line 1607, in pandas._libs.hashtable.PyObjectHashTable.get_item
     File "pandas/_libs/hashtable_class_helper.pxi", line 1614, in pandas._libs.hashtable.PyObjectHashTable.get_item
   KeyError: 'ts'
   
   During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
   
   Traceback (most recent call last):
     File "/spark/python/lib/pyspark.zip/pyspark/worker.py", line 599, in main
       process()
     File "/spark/python/lib/pyspark.zip/pyspark/worker.py", line 591, in process
       serializer.dump_stream(out_iter, outfile)
     File "/spark/python/lib/pyspark.zip/pyspark/sql/pandas/serializers.py", line 255, in dump_stream
       return ArrowStreamSerializer.dump_stream(self, init_stream_yield_batches(), stream)
     File "/spark/python/lib/pyspark.zip/pyspark/sql/pandas/serializers.py", line 88, in dump_stream
       for batch in iterator:
     File "/spark/python/lib/pyspark.zip/pyspark/sql/pandas/serializers.py", line 249, in init_stream_yield_batches
       batch = self._create_batch(series)
     File "/spark/python/lib/pyspark.zip/pyspark/sql/pandas/serializers.py", line 182, in _create_batch
       for field in t]
     File "/spark/python/lib/pyspark.zip/pyspark/sql/pandas/serializers.py", line 182, in <listcomp>
       for field in t]
     File "/opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas/core/frame.py", line 2995, in __getitem__
       indexer = self.columns.get_loc(key)
     File "/opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas/core/indexes/base.py", line 2899, in get_loc
       return self._engine.get_loc(self._maybe_cast_indexer(key))
     File "pandas/_libs/index.pyx", line 107, in pandas._libs.index.IndexEngine.get_loc
     File "pandas/_libs/index.pyx", line 131, in pandas._libs.index.IndexEngine.get_loc
     File "pandas/_libs/hashtable_class_helper.pxi", line 1607, in pandas._libs.hashtable.PyObjectHashTable.get_item
     File "pandas/_libs/hashtable_class_helper.pxi", line 1614, in pandas._libs.hashtable.PyObjectHashTable.get_item
   KeyError: 'ts'
   ```
   
   but I don't directly see how this is related to pyarrow. There seems to be going something wrong in the serialization

BryanCutler commented on issue #6294: ARROW-7693: [CI] Fix test name for Spark integration, add new tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6294#issuecomment-579462164
 
 
   Ok, so the problem seems to be that a Timestamp Column from a Table loses it's name when converted to Pandas. It only seems to be if its a timestamp type, and I'm not sure what the correct behavior is since the "Column" is actually a `ChunkedArray` and doesn't really have a name anymore.  Here is a simple repro:
   ```python
   In [23]: a1 = pa.array([pd.Timestamp.now()])                                                                                 
   
   In [24]: a2 = pa.array([1])                                                                                                  
   
   In [25]: t = pa.Table.from_arrays([a1, a2], ['ts', 'a'])                                                                     
   
   In [26]: for c in t: 
       ...:     print(c.to_pandas()) 
       ...:                                                                                                                     
   0   2020-01-28 13:17:26.738708
   dtype: datetime64[ns]
   0    1
   Name: a, dtype: int64
   ```
   What are your thoughts on if this is a bug or not @wesm @jorisvandenbossche ?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

BryanCutler commented on issue #6294: ARROW-7693: [CI] Fix test name for Spark integration, add new tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6294#issuecomment-579462164
 
 
   Ok, so the problem seems to be that a Timestamp Column from a Table loses it's name when converted to Pandas. It only seems to be if its a timestamp type, and I'm not sure what the correct behavior is since the "Column" is actually a `ChunkedArray` and doesn't really have a name anymore.  Here is a simple repro:
   ```python
   In [23]: a1 = pa.array([pd.Timestamp.now()])                                                                                 
   
   In [24]: a2 = pa.array([1])                                                                                                  
   
   In [25]: t = pa.Table.from_arrays([a1, a2], ['ts', 'a'])                                                                     
   
   In [26]: for c in t: 
       ...:     print(c.to_pandas()) 
       ...:                                                                                                                     
   0   2020-01-28 13:17:26.738708
   dtype: datetime64[ns]
   0    1
   Name: a, dtype: int64
   ```
   What are your thoughts on if this is a bug or not in pyarrow @wesm @jorisvandenbossche ?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6294: ARROW-7693: [CI] Fix test name for Spark integration, add new tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6294#issuecomment-579465791
 
 
   Ah, yes, that's a bug. 
   And it seems to depend on the resolution:
   
   ```
   In [52]: table = pa.table({'a': pd.date_range("2012", periods=3), 'b': [1, 2, 3]})  
   
   In [53]: table.column('a').to_pandas()  # ns resolution
   Out[53]: 
   0   2012-01-01
   1   2012-01-02
   2   2012-01-03
   Name: a, dtype: datetime64[ns]
   
   In [54]: table = pa.table({'a': pa.array([1, 2, 3], pa.timestamp('us')), 'b': [1, 2, 3]}) 
   
   In [55]: table.column('a').to_pandas()
   Out[55]: 
   0   1970-01-01 00:00:00.000001
   1   1970-01-01 00:00:00.000002
   2   1970-01-01 00:00:00.000003
   dtype: datetime64[ns]
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6294: ARROW-7693: [CI] Fix test name for Spark integration, add new tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6294#issuecomment-579468239
 
 
   It is a regression due to the change I did here (https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/af6fa24be0dbbc021e0844c63d1c0b89fb23a95c): 
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/2205caa39f6dbd74fbceb3f8cd8ddaa9067f064d/python/pyarrow/array.pxi#L1124-L1126
   
   The `cast` probably looses the stored name.
   
   (I can do a fix tomorrow, I don't know what the status is of the release process)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
